div.head: Samuel Crefsey. Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. I Samuel Crefsey of Charles County being very
sick and weake of body but praised be good for the same of sound and perfect
emory do make ordaine & constitute this my last will and testament in
manner and form following first I bequeath my soul into the hands of almighty
God that give it and my bpdy to the earth to be desently buried as shall please my
Executor hereafter named trusting through the merrits of my Lord & Savior
Jesus
Jesus Christ to obtain pardon and profession of all my offenses next I give and
bequeath unto George Robertson one young bay horse branded with SC on
rear buttock about thee years of age know by the name of Robin and one
yearling cow calf that came of Called Cole and one small gunt that
the Indian hath out to hunt and I desire that he may be sent down to
Robert Thomas his wife son have hes head cured at the spring of the year
next I desire all my Just Debts may be well and truly satisfied and
for what land I hold in the pronvince I doe give and bequeath unto my two
Daughters Mary and Susanna when they shall come to years of Age
Likewise the remainder of my Estate I give and bequeath every part & parcel thereof
to my said two Daughters to be equally divided beween them when thet come
to years of disifson.

And I do hereny nominate and appoint Richard Edelin my loving friend
to see this my last will and testament performed to whome I doe bequeath
one seale ring sent me out of England but as yet on board Capt. Paine
hereby revoking all former or other wills by me made In witness whereof
I have hereunto set my hand and seal this 21st of January 1676.

Signed Sealed and Delivered
In presence of us
Ann ; Henry Trent
Sa. Crifsey

On the back of the aforegoing was the following probits (to wit)
4th February 1675. Henry Trent made oath that he was preset at the signing
Sealing and Delivering of the within Last Will and Testament by the within
Testator and that at the signing sealed and Delivering thereof he was
around dispersing mine with an intent to make it as his last will and
testament before me signed by order of the Judge Testamentary.
Michael Readford Clerk

Ann Steppo made oath that she was present at the signing sealing and
Delivery of the within last will and testament by the within testator
and that at the signing sealing and Delivery thereof he was of sound desiring
mind
minf with a intent to make it as hes last will and testament before me
Feb. the 6th 1675/6
5 1/2 sides
Lean Jourdan
